word_mean: 梦：睡眠时出现的一种精神现象，此时影象、情绪与思想都具有真实感。做梦发生于快速动眼相(REM)睡眠。这种睡眠相一夜有四、五次，总持续时间约90分钟。Freud首创从心理学解释梦，认为梦是受抑制的无意识冲动与愿望的有意识表现

sentence.Network_en: When the right woman comes along, this bad dream will be over.
sentence.Network_cn: 当有合适的女人出现时，这种胡思乱想就会停止了。

sentence.Network_en: In a dream you can be transported back in time.
sentence.Network_cn: 在梦里你可以回到过去。

sentence.Network_en: It's as if I'm living in a hazy dream world.
sentence.Network_cn: 我好像生活在缥缈的梦境里。

美国梦（American Dream），是一种相信只要在美国经过努力不懈的奋斗便能获致更好生活的理想，亦即人们必须透过自己的工作勤 …

jx.jx_en_mean: bigger or better than could be reasonably expected
jx.jx_cn_mean: 大大超过所望的（地），大大出乎意料的（地）

lj.lj_ly: stockbrokers command salaries beyond the wildest dreams of most workers.
lj.lj_ls: 股票经纪人薪水之高是大多数工人做梦也想不到的。

jx.jx_en_mean: used in spoken English to assert that something much desired is not likely ever to happen
[with negative]used to emphasize that a situation is beyond the scope of one's imagination

lj.lj_ly: she could never in her wildest dreams have imagined the summer weather in New York.
lj.lj_ls: 她做梦也无法想像纽约夏天的天气。

lj.lj_ly: the car is still running like a dream.
lj.lj_ls: 那辆车行驶起来依然像梦一样完美。

jx.jx_en_mean: [in imperative](informal)used, especially in spoken English, as an ironic comment on the unlikely or impractical nature of a plan or aspiration
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)做梦（尤在口语中用于讽刺某计划或想法的不现实）

lj.lj_ly: Dean thinks he's going to get the job. Dream on, Babe.
lj.lj_ls: 迪安认为他会得到那份工作。做梦吧，宝贝。

lj.lj_ly: he's been dreaming up new ways of attracting customers.
lj.lj_ls: 他一直在大胆设想吸引顾客的新办法。

lj.lj_ly: dreamed up a plan to corner the market.
lj.lj_ls: 构想出一个计划来垄断市场

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: of Germanic origin, related to Dutch droom and German Traum, and probably also to Old English drēam 'joy, music'

encyclopedia.content: 韩剧名，《Dream》讲述的是由金范饰演的从少管所出来的李长石与由朱镇模所饰演的体育经纪人一起经历艰难困苦最终成长为一名成功的格斗选手的故事。剧中孙丹菲饰演的是一名搏击操教练朴苏妍，金范与Marco饰演的是特种格斗选手。日本一歌唱女子组合也名Dream。

entry.def: A dream is an imaginary series of events that you experience in your mind while you are asleep.

example.ex: He had a dream about Claire...
example.tran: 他梦见了克莱尔。

example.ex: I had a dream that I was in an old study, surrounded by leather books.
example.tran: 我梦见我在一间古老的书房里,四周全是皮装书。

entry.def: When you dream, you experience imaginary events in your mind while you are asleep.

example.ex: Ivor dreamed that he was on a bus...
example.tran: 艾弗梦见他在一辆公共汽车上。

example.ex: She dreamed about her baby.
example.tran: 她梦见了她的宝宝。

entry.def: You can refer to a situation or event as a dream if you often think about it because you would like it to happen.

example.ex: He had finally accomplished his dream of becoming a pilot...
example.tran: 他最终实现了成为一名飞行员的梦想。

example.ex: My dream is to have a house in the country...
example.tran: 我梦想在乡间拥有一栋房子。

entry.def: If you often think about something that you would very much like to happen or have, you can say that you dream of it.

example.ex: As a schoolgirl, she had dreamed of becoming an actress...
example.tran: 她上学时曾梦想成为一名女演员。

example.ex: For most of us, a brand new designer kitchen is something we can only dream about...
example.tran: 对我们大多数人来说,一间崭新的由著名设计师设计的厨房只能是一种梦想。

entry.tran: 理想的;梦幻般的;完美的
entry.def: You can use dream to describe something that you think is ideal or perfect, especially if it is something that you thought you would never be able to have or experience.

example.ex: He had his dream house built on the banks of the river Bure.
example.tran: 他在布尔河畔建造了他的梦幻屋。

example.ex: ...a dream holiday to Jamaica.
example.tran: 牙买加梦幻之旅

entry.tran: 理想;夙愿;梦寐以求的事物
entry.def: If you describe something as a particular person's dream, you think that it would be ideal for that person and that he or she would like it very much.

example.ex: Greece is said to be a botanist's dream...
example.tran: 据说希腊是植物学家梦寐以求的地方。

example.ex: He's every girl's dream!
example.tran: 他是所有姑娘的梦中情人！

entry.def: If you say that something is a dream, you mean that it is wonderful.
You can refer to a situation or event that does not seem real as a dream, especially if it is very strange or unpleasant.

example.ex: When the right woman comes along, this bad dream will be over.
example.tran: 当有合适的女人出现时,这种胡思乱想就会停止了。

entry.def: If you say that you would not dream of doing something, you are emphasizing that you would never do it because you think it is wrong or is not possible or suitable for you.

example.ex: I wouldn't dream of making fun of you...
example.tran: 我绝不会取笑你。

example.ex: My sons would never dream of expecting their clothes to be ironed.
example.tran: 我的几个儿子从不指望别人帮他们熨好衣服。

entry.def: If you say that you never dreamed that something would happen, you are emphasizing that you did not think that it would happen because it seemed very unlikely.

example.ex: I never dreamed that I would be able to afford a home here...
example.tran: 我从没想到我在这儿能买得起房子。

example.ex: Who could ever dream of a disaster like this?...
example.tran: 谁能想到会发生这样的灾难？

entry.def: If you tell someone to dream on, you mean that something they are hoping for is unlikely to happen.

example.ex: 'Perhaps one day I may go on a relaxing holiday.' — 'Yeah, dream on.'
example.tran: “也许有一天我可以享受一个放松身心的假期。”——“是啊,你就做梦吧。”

entry.def: If you say that you are in a dream, you mean that you do not concentrate properly on what you are doing because you are thinking about other things.

example.ex: All day long I moved in a dream.
example.tran: 整整一天我都心不在焉。

entry.tran: 梦幻般地;美妙地;完美地
entry.def: If you say that someone does something like a dream, you think that they do it very well. If you say that something happens like a dream, you mean that it happens successfully without any problems.

example.ex: She cooked like a dream...
example.tran: 她烹饪技艺精湛。

example.ex: His ship had sailed like a dream.
example.tran: 他的船行驶十分顺畅。

entry.def: If you describe someone or something as the person or thing of your dreams, you mean that you consider them to be ideal or perfect.

example.ex: This could be the man of my dreams.
example.tran: 这就是我理想中的男子。

entry.tran: （强调极为奇怪或完全不可能）再怎么想也
entry.def: If you say that you could not imagine a particular thing in your wildest dreams, you are emphasizing that you think it is extremely strange or unlikely.

example.ex: Never in my wildest dreams did I think we could win.
example.tran: 我做梦也没想到我们会赢。

entry.tran: 超出想象的;比希望中要好的
entry.def: If you describe something as being beyond your wildest dreams, you are emphasizing that it is better than you could have imagined or hoped for.

example.ex: She had already achieved success beyond her wildest dreams.
example.tran: 她已经取得超乎想象的成功。

means.word_mean: 1. a series of mental images and emotions occurring during sleep;

sentences.sentence: "I had a dream about you last night"

means.word_mean: 2. a cherished desire;

sentences.sentence: "his ambition is to own his own business"

means.word_mean: 3. imaginative thoughts indulged in while awake;

sentences.sentence: "he lives in a dream that has nothing to do with reality"

means.word_mean: 4. a fantastic but vain hope (from fantasies induced by the opium pipe);

sentences.sentence: "I have this pipe dream about being emperor of the universe"

means.word_mean: 5. a state of mind characterized by abstraction and release from reality;

sentences.sentence: "he went about his work as if in a dream"

means.word_mean: 6. someone of something wonderful;
1. have a daydream; indulge in a fantasy
2. experience while sleeping;

auth_sentence.res_content: Vox pops My dream is to be a photographer.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Vox pops My dream is to be a photographer.

auth_sentence.content: Backwards is much more than a completist's dream.
auth_sentence.res_content: Backwards is much more than a completist's dream.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Backwards is much more than a completist's dream.

auth_sentence.content: On Dream On he emulates some nifty Byrds guitars.
auth_sentence.res_content: On Dream On he emulates some nifty Byrds guitars.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: On Dream On he emulates some nifty Byrds guitars.

Sentence.sentence: If you think so, you're not alone, because energy independence has been the dream of American president for decades, and never more so than in the past few years, when the most recent oil price shock has been partly responsible for kicking off the great recession.
It has long been everyone's dream
A little more tangible (可触摸的 ), a little less of a dream.
They resonated(共鸣) with optimism and ambition in much the same way as the most famous dream speech of all, delivered by Martin Luther King Jr.
On the flip side, companies like Virgin Galactic are plotting a bottom-up assault on the space dream by making it a reality to the public
It sounded very much like a dream.

means.word_mean: 梦

sentences.en: I often return in dreams to my hometown.
sentences.cn: 我常常在梦中回到我的故乡。

means.word_mean: 梦一般美好的人或事物

sentences.en: In the past she lived in a dream.
sentences.cn: 过去, 她过着梦一般的生活。

means.word_mean: 抱负, 理想, 梦想

sentences.en: It's my dream to win a Nobel Prize.
sentences.cn: 我的理想是获得诺贝尔奖。

means.word_mean: 做梦; 向往, 想象，梦想
想到, 料到

sentences.en: Who'd have dreamt it? They're getting married!
sentences.cn: 谁能想到?他们都快结婚了！

means.word_mean: [常用于疑问句或否定句]考虑到，想到，料到

sentences.en: I never dreamed that such a thing could happen!
sentences.cn: 我做梦也没想到会出这种事!

means.word_mean: 做白日梦，梦想，幻想，空想；想望；向往(of， about)

sentences.en: She dreamt about vacation plans when she should have been working.
sentences.cn: 她在本应工作时胡思乱想着度假计划。

means.word_mean: [常用于疑问句和否定句]想，料想，考虑；想像(of)

sentences.en: I wouldn't dream of inviting him.

means.word_mean: 显得如梦境一样宁静；静止不动

jushi.english: Our dream is for lasting peace.
jushi.chinese: 我们的心愿是持久和平。

jushi.english: She awaked from a dream at midnight.
If I win the tournament, my dream will come true.
jushi.chinese: 如果我能赢得锦标赛,我的梦想就实现了。
